properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The major winter storm continues. A very moist Pacific frontal system will remain stalled over the coastal passes this evening and tonight giving continued heavy wet snow near the summits. The snow will be mixed with rain at times today. Further snowfall accumulations are uncertain due to how wet the snow is. Amounts of more than 30 cm are possible by Thursday morning. The snow will finally end Thursday morning as the system moves out of the region. ### Road closures are possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T15:14:17-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T23:15:17-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0452340132.2020
Area: Haines Road - Haines Junction to Pleasant Camp, South Klondike Highway - Carcross to White Pass
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Easterly winds will gust up to 90 kilometres per hour over Umiujaq today. Winds will ease this evening. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T02:59:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T20:43:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3338074574.2020
Area: Umiujaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Water Supply Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By Town Of Assiniboia
properties.Summary:
Description: The Town of Assiniboia is issuing a Water Supply Advisory Alert due to levels of turbidity in the raw water source. This has resulted in a limited supply of treated water.
Expires: 2020-12-07T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-12-02T12:13:30-06:00, F9CDBA99-C339-B721-A820-27C01A10B0C9
Area: Town of Assiniboia and any users drawing water from this treated water source.
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Update For The Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Issued By The Village Of Coleville
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory issued for the Village of Coleville. This advisory is for the entire community and for any individuals who may access the Village of Coleville water system. This advisory has been extended and is in effect until further notice.
Expires: 2020-12-09T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-12-02T11:23:10-06:00, B5C30C85-DF3F-2BB7-0395-778F75AAC247
Area: Village of Coleville

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Total rainfall: 40 to 55 mm, locally 75 mm. Locations: Burin and Connaigre Peninsulas. Time span: continuing until Thursday morning. Remarks: Rain, at times heavy tonight before tapering off Thursday morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-03T13:59:59-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T02:38:59-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0387705104.2020
Area: Burin Peninsula, Connaigre
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of about 20 cm is expected. Locations: Nain and Natuashish. Time span: until early Thursday morning. Remarks: Northeasterly or easterly winds gusting to 50 to 60 km/h will reduce visibilities in blowing snow tonight. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-12-03T10:59:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T02:40:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1010021671.2020
Area: Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. Snow heavy at times tonight and early Thursday morning. A Pacific frontal system over the region is resulting in snowfall accumulations of up to 20 cm. The snow will end by Thursday afternoon as the system moves out of the region. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T15:12:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T23:13:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3149129105.2020
Area: Dempster

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds and blowing snow Thursday to Friday morning. Winds will increase significantly on Thursday with gusts near 60 km/h expected by mid-day and increasing to near 90 km/h by late afternoon. These strong winds will cause low visibility in blowing snow. By Thursday afternoon, the addition of falling snow will likely bring blizzard conditions, potentially lasting until early Friday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T13:50:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T21:51:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3826773221.2020
Area: Cambridge Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds and blizzard conditions for Sachs Harbour tonight until Friday. Blowing snow with winds gusting near 60 km/h from the east are continuing this evening. As the winds increase throughout the evening and snow begins to fall, blizzard conditions will develop and last until Thursday night. Winds will gust up to 100 km/h, with the strongest winds occurring overnight tonight into Thursday morning. Easterly winds are expected to weaken slightly Thursday evening before switching to westerly Thursday night. Winds will gust near 80 km/h, and blizzard conditions are expected again. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T14:32:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T22:33:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2046252118.2020
Area: Sachs Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing precipitation amounts of 1 to 2 millimetres are forecast this evening. Freezing rain will change over to snow during the evening. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T05:59:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-03T02:03:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4239961867.2020
Area: Schefferville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong easterly winds will whip up the snow and produce blizzard conditions over this community beginning Wednesday evening. Conditions should improve on Thursday. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T12:47:48-00:00

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Very strong damaging winds and blizzard conditions will develop early Thursday morning. Winds gusting near 75 km/h from the east are continuing this evening. Winds will increase throughout the night, with the strongest winds occurring by Thursday morning and last until the afternoon. Gusts up to 110 km/h are possible. Winds will switch to the west Thursday evening and are likely to continue to gust near 80 km/h until Friday afternoon. Due to the strong winds and some falling snow, blizzard conditions are also expected. Some blowing snow is already occurring and visibilities will worsen as the winds increase tonight. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to widespread poor visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-12-03T14:38:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-12-02T22:39:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1084997547.2020
Area: Ulukhaktok
properties.Author: Environment Canada
